newsitem.title: UK: RESEARCH ALERT - Lehman cuts C&W to "neutral".
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Lehman cuts C&W to "neutral".

text.p: UK telecoms group Cable & Wireless Plc was cut to "neutral" from "outperform" at Lehman Brothers, the investment bank said on Friday.

In a research note, Lehman said C&W had overpaid by 30 percent in its recent $652 million purchase of a 49 percent stake in the Panamanian telephone company and that there was "little strategic value" in the acquisition.

It also noted that recent figures from telecoms regulator Oftel showed C&W's Mercury unit rapidly losing market share in several retail markets, particularly in business outgoing international calls where its share fell to 22 percent in the second quarter from 26 percent a year before.

Lehman said C&W was trading at an 18 percent discount to its sum-of-parts valuation, dropping to 10 percent once its Hong Kong Telecom stake was valued at the "realistic" 15 percent discount C&W was likley to get in any sale.
"We consider this fully values the stock and are therefore downgrading to neutral," Lehman said.
